alert.note: Alert for Bowie; Cass; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:49PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Little River, southern Hempstead, Miller, north central Lafayette, southeastern McCurtain, northern Cass, Bowie, northern Morris, northeastern Titus and southeastern Red River Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wilkerson to Fouke. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Hope, Wake Village, Ashdown, New Boston, Boxelder, Nash, Hooks, De Kalb, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Fouke, Garland, Fulton, Ogden, Mandeville, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Genoa and Wilkerson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
